星島網 星島電子報 頭條日報 The Standard 東周刊 親子王 caz buyer 東Touch PCM 電腦廣場 Oh!爸媽 JobMarket 頭條揾工 EDUPLUS 星島環球 頭條金融報 頭條馬網 星島頭條 資訊生活服務平台
一APP生活「Sync」到 《星島頭條》流動應用程式(APP)是一個結合生活、新聞資訊、視頻、個人化功能及生活實用小工具的綜合平台。 了解更多 關於我們 聯絡我們 隱私政策聲明 使用條款 版權及免責聲明 幫助及反饋 我要爆料 Copyright © 2024 SingTao Ltd.All rights reserved. 主頁 國際 即時國際 8隻爆粗鸚鵡與92隻乖鸚鵡同住受感化 結果令動物園驚喜 即時國際 更新時間：07:00 2024-03-01
發佈時間：07:00 2024-03-01 字體大小 英國林肯郡野生動物園（Lincolnshire Wildlife Park）園內有8隻非洲灰鸚鵡經常講粗口，對着遊客也照講，園方早前宣布一項「感化計畫」，讓牠們跟92隻乖巧的鸚鵡一起生活。
原本園方最壞打算是乖的也學壞，變成「100隻爆粗鸚鵡」，沒想到實驗成功，幾隻爆粗鸚鵡明顯有進步，其中一隻變成狂唱「祝你聖誕快樂」。
延伸閱讀： 爆粗鸚鵡教壞同類反爆紅 英動物園「隔離薰陶」行動升級 該動物園2020年8月收容了5隻被飼主遺棄的非洲灰鸚鵡，以「出口成髒」聞名，甚至對着遊客也罵超難聽的髒話。更糟糕的是，後來有3隻鸚鵡被帶壞，變成8隻髒話鸚鵡小隊。園方傷透腦筋，一度在籠外點免責警告標語稱：「我們不對您聽到的聲音負責。」
為了矯正8隻鸚鵡的壞習慣，園方採取冒險手段，將牠們和92隻不說髒話乖鸚鵡關在一起，希望達到「教化」效果。最初擔心最終會變成100隻髒話鸚鵡大隊，所幸實驗一個月後傳來好消息。
改唱《聖誕快樂》《友誼萬歲》 最近動物園總經理尼可斯（Steve Nichols）分享說，「爆粗鸚鵡」已經不太罵髒話，向其他鸚鵡學到「微波爐和氣炸鍋的聲音」。他提到，其中一隻鸚鵡變成狂唱《祝你聖誕快樂》和（蘇格蘭民謠）《友誼萬歲》，雖然「在2月似乎已經不合適」。
尼可斯坦言，當鸚鵡們愛罵髒話的新聞傳開後，來自世界各地的遊客想來一睹髒話鸚鵡的風彩，還有人想教鸚鵡罵髒話，「我們帶研究團體參訪時，還曾看到一位80歲的女團員做同樣的事，慫恿鸚鵡複製她說的髒話。」他強調，還是不希望鸚鵡在孩子面用那些不雅字眼。
—
《星島頭條》APP經已推出最新版本，請立即更新，瀏覽更精彩內容： https://bit.ly/3yLrgYZ

author: @herzindagi
title: Menstrual Cups May Not Be That Safe: 5 Potential Dangers You Should Know About
text: In the past few years, Menstrual cups have gained popularity owing to their sustainability and easy usage. However, there are potential dangers associated with it. Scroll down to learn about the potential dangers of using a menstrual cup.

author: Mary O'Connor, David Wilkes
title: MI5 wanted rogue spy report kept from MI6 - The Mail
text: MI5 was so desperate to stop MI6 colleagues seeing the full bombshell report into how one of its agents went rogue that Margaret Thatcher limited her foreign secretary’s use of the document, the papers reveal. [Try for £1](https://www.mailsubscriptions.co.uk/products/197224/1-for-3-months-then-12.99-a-month) [Sign in] AS the glamorous actress making her formal entrance into the Royal Family, she should have been the star of the show. TO some, it sounded like a freight train roaring past right outside their front windows. THREE men have died after their car plunged into a river, police confirmed yesterday. STORM Gerrit continued to cause chaos yesterday as ‘supercell thunderstorms’ brought widespread travel disruption. CHRISTMAS is over, the fridge is bare again and the nights are still long - it can be easy to see January as a dull, dour month. GOVERNING bodies should have their funding cut if they fail to protect female sports amid concern about trans- gender players, a leading think-tank says. Commentary by Daley Thompson, Olympic Gold Medallist Fire crews race to terrifying blaze drama at Blackpool Tower... that turned out to be orange plastic net flapping in the wind IT is the time of year when families spending days together at home often start a challenging new jigsaw puzzle. A WELSH Labour council is lobbying to reintroduce tolls on the Severn bridges in a fresh attack on hard-up motorists. LABOUR was mocked yesterday for drawing up proposals to create thousands of nursery places without being able to say how it would pay for them. AN Auschwitz survivor has described feeling ‘very humbled’ to receive a personal letter and flowers from the King to mark her 100th birthday. THE Princess of Wales is set to turn her attention to the importance of fathers in children’s early years. ELLIE Goulding has revealed she felt ‘vulnerable’ and ‘intimidated’ working in the male-dominated music industry early in her career. THE number of young people out of work due to long-term sickness has doubled since 2010. CIVIL servants have been over-promoted in a bid to get around public sector pay restraints, a think-tank has warned. A ‘HAPPINESS Unit’ backed by the Government is set to close due to funding cuts. THE BBC is feeding licence feepayers a ‘diet of woke bias’ in its original programming and news content, a campaign group has claimed. Rwanda-style scheme was considered as ‘nuclear option’ TONY Blair faced a quandary about what to do with John Prescott when he complained about not having a proper role in government, the files show. THE No10 Press Office had lost ‘all credibility’ under the combative communications chief Alastair Campbell, Tony Blair was warned. A PUBLIC inquiry after the Soham murders of schoolgirls Holly Wells and Jessica Chapman was opposed by Tony Blair, the files reveal. AN idea to use the Elgin Marbles as a ‘bargaining chip’ in London’s bid to host the 2012 Olympics was backed by Tony Blair, the files reveal. MI5 was so desperate to stop MI6 colleagues seeing the full bombshell report into how one of its agents went rogue that Margaret Thatcher limited her foreign secretary’s use of the document, the papers reveal. CHERIE Blair was ‘adamant’ her husband should sit for a portrait to be hung in London’s Lincoln’s Inn where he trained as a barrister - but it caused a headache for aides. MARGARET Thatcher’s government feared embarrassment if extracts from the controversial Spycatcher book were read in the Commons, files released today reveal. PIERCE Brosnan has found himself in hot water after allegedly wandering into off-limits springs at a national park. GROWING purple vegetables, from carrots to tomatoes, is set to be among the biggest gardening trends for 2024. RED Wall Tories yesterday urged Rishi Sunak to focus on cutting taxes for working families rather than slashing death duties for the better off. KEMI Badenoch has cemented her place as a front runner to succeed Rishi Sunak after she was named ‘minister of the year’ in a poll of Tory activists. A FATHER out walking with his young family was killed by a car driven at a group of people after he had stopped to help an injured woman. L’OREAL heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers has become the first woman to amass a fortune of $100billion (£790million), it was revealed yesterday. CHILDREN with severe epilepsy have been offered brain surgery by the NHS before medicinal cannabis, parents have revealed. SIR Lindsay Hoyle has racked up a bill of more than £125,000 in a year to jet around the globe. STEAKHOUSE attacker Tristan Sherry was shot in the head with his own sub machine gun during a botched hit on Christmas Eve. CHER has filed court papers seeking to control her adult son Elijah Blue Allman’s affairs by placing him into a conservatorship, it has emerged. THE British Museum is still pursuing a deal to return the Elgin Marbles - despite opposition from the Prime Minister, George Osborne has revealed. A TEENAGER was left fighting for her life after reportedly catching a deadly strain of E.coli from food at a festive market. WHEN preparing breakfast, you don’t want an unsavoury character like Mr Burns from The Simpsons showing up. FREED Israeli hostage Mia Schem has broken her silence to reveal a harrowing account of her captivity in Gaza. THE number of anti-Semitic hate crimes jumped in the month following the outbreak of the Hamas-Israel conflict, latest police figures reveal.
